page.title: 12Womens Institute Mickleton
page.content: In the 1980's the institute offers a varied programme of events for the ladies of the village in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.THEATRE TRIPS and COACH OUTINGS are very popular with members.MONTHLY LECTURES are keenly attended;they cater for everyone's interests from crafts to philosophy.Home-made entertainment fills in when required.We take part in GROUP AND COUNTY EVENTS within our movement and take interest in NATIONAL CURRENT AFFAIRS.In 1984 we staged our exhibition"MICKLETON PAST PRESENT AND FUTURE"-a pictorial survey,displays of craft work by members,and practical demonstrations.Efforts are made every year to FUND RAISE FOR CHARITIES by way of Coffee Mornings,Raffles,Waste and 'Silver' Paper Collections.Teas are served by ladies at village events and to members of visiting Institutes.
